definitions.definition: a long, narrow piece of material with a sticky substance on one side that is used for sticking things together

examples.text: Fit the carpet using double-sided tape.

definitions.definition: a long, thin piece of magnetic material, used for recording sounds, pictures or information, especially before digital technology became available

examples.text: Twenty years ago he was **caught on tape** in a very embarrassing situation.
I have all my school concert performances recorded on tape.

definitions.definition: a cassette that contains sounds, or sounds and pictures, that have been recorded

examples.text: a **blank tape** *(= a tape with nothing recorded on it)*
Someone had deliberately erased the tapes.
The singer was miming to a pre-recorded tape.
What does this tape have on it?
Police seized various books and tapes.

definitions.definition: a narrow piece of material that is used for tying things together or as a label

examples.text: The papers were in a pile, tied together with a tape.

definitions.definition: a long, thin piece of material that is stretched across the place where a race will finish or used to mark off an area

examples.text: Police tape cordoned off the street in front of the house.

definitions.definition: a long thin piece of plastic, cloth or flexible metal that has measurements marked on it and is used for measuring the length or height of something

wordOrigin: Old English tæppa, tæppe; perhaps related to Middle Low German teppen ‘pluck, tear’.
